label: 受領
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 3:  Medieval Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1990
説明文: Career governors of the mid-to late Heian period appointed by the provincial governor (kokushi) to carry out administrative functions in the province while the latter remained in the capital. They were able to enrich themselves through harsh taxation, and thus this term is often translated as tax manager."　[国司]　"
